title: Corrie's Julie Hesmondhalgh moved in with husband a WEEK after first date
text:
Coronation Street legend Julie Hesmondhalgh has revealed she moved in with her now husband after just one week of dating and was pregnant within six weeks.

Julie, who played Hayley Cropper on the show between 1998 and 2014, met her husband Ian Kershaw, who was then an actor and is now a screenwriter on the show, while filming the soap 18 years ago.

The TV star, 49, said her daughter Martha was conceived following a night out with her soap colleagues and she told Ian afterwards, 'I'm going to marry you'.

That was quick! Julie Hesmondhalgh, 49, who played Hayley Cropper on Coronation Street between 1998 and 2014, has discussed her whirlwind romance with husband Ian Kershaw

Speaking in an interview with the Sunday Mirror's Notebook magazine, Hayley admitted she texted Ian and demanded 'a top wedding and kid by next Christmas!'.

The former Corrie favourite's bold move paid off and a week later she had moved in with Ian.

Julie, who recently appeared in Broadchurch and Doctor Who, said: 'We went out on the Thursday night, I moved in with him on the following Wednesday and I was pregnant within six weeks.

Very much in love: The TV star, 49, said her daughter Martha was conceived following a night out with her soap colleagues and she told Ian afterwards, 'I'm going to marry you'

'It’s just been like the greatest thing in my life,' she added.

However, the star revealed her insistence the couple had to keep courting each other because of the ultra-fast pregnancy and she said make an effort to keep the romance alive.

Ian is so committed to Julie that she said he wrote a one-woman play for her called The Greatest Play In The World.

She has since performed it in Edinburgh and will be doing it in London in December, she said.

TV legend: Julie revealed in 2017 that Hayley Cropper character, who was transgender, was originally cast as a joke

Julie's latest interview comes after she previously revealed that her Hayley Cropper character, who was transgender, was originally cast as a joke.

She said her role was only meant to last for two weeks - but she ended up playing the character for an incredible 16 years.

Speaking to the Sunday Telegraph's Stella Magazine Hesmondhalgh said: 'I wasn't meant to be in Coronation Street for any longer than two weeks.

'The character of Hayley was originally written as a joke. It wasn't a politically correct one, but this was back in 1998.

'The joke was that Roy Cropper (David Neilson) was going to go on a series of disastrous blind dates, one of them being with a man who had transgendered to a woman.'

Julie most recently appeared on the small screen in an episode of the 11th series of Doctor Who.
description: Coronation Street legend Julie Hesmondhalgh has revealed she moved in with her now husband after just one week of dating and was pregnant within six weeks.
